2m castle wall topper.
Castle wall top corner. Looks correct when placed, even though it's odd on it's own.
2m radius 26 degree curved roof point.
2m radius 45 degree curved roof point.
2m radius 60 degree curved roof point.
4m to 2m radius 26 degree curved roof.
4m to 2m radius 45 degree curved roof.
4m radius outer roof edge.
26 degree sloped roof.
45 degree sloped roof.
26 degree outer corner roof.
45 degree outer corner roof.
26 degree inner corner roof.
45 degree inner corner roof.
26 degree center roof ridge.
45 degree center roof ridge.
2m radius, outer roof edge.
2m radius, shorter outer roof edge.
4m radius, shorter outer roof edge.
Decorative outer castle wall support piece.
Stone wall panneling for decoration only. Snaps to top or bottom of any flat wall piece with small gap for floor tiles above or below.
Wood wall panneling for decoration only. Snaps to top or bottom of any flat wall piece with small gap for floor tiles above or below.
First decorative corbel. To be placed along the top outside of the Castle walls.
Second decorative corbel. To be placed along the top outside of the Castle walls.
Third decorative corbel. To be placed along the top outside of the Castle walls.
Decorative corbel corners. Matches first and third corbels.
Decorative corbel corners. Matches the second corbel.
Walkway made of stones. Doesn't look very plesant to walk on.
Harringbone patterend paving stone floor.
River rock floor. Only slightly better than the one made of rough stones.
Looser river rock floor, still not the most comfortable, but useful.
Honecomb pattern floor tiles. Very pretty, and comfortable to walk on.
Flat stone or paver walkway. Comfortable to walk on, easy to maintain.
Cinderblock or stone block floor. Classic castle and dungeon flooring.
Brick floor that matches the brick walls.
Low platform. Floors can be placed on top to match the height of stairs.
Slate floor that matches the stairs and platform.
2m radius low platform. Floors can be placed on top to match the height of stairs.
4m radius low platform. Floors can be placed on top to match the height of stairs.
Slate 1/8 circle 2m radius floor tile.
Slate 1/8 circle 4m radius floor tile.
Simple wooden arched bridge for crossing small gaps
2m center section of a snappable bridge.
4m middle section of a snappable bridge.
Sloped section of a snappable bridge. Makes a great entrance or exit ramp.
Wooden bridge support.
Extra wooden bridge support poles, for extending the bridge support height.
2m section of stone snappable bridge.
4m section of stone snappable bridge.
2m low sloped section of snappable stone bridge.
2m medium sloped section of snappable stone bridge.
1/2 arch for snappable stone bridge. Provides support for the bridge.
Longer support for snappable stone bridge arch.
Fancier stone bridge with 1/2 arch.
2m section of fancy snappable stone bridge.
4m section of fancy snappable stone bridge.
2m section of snappable wooden fencing for the wooden bridges.
2m low sloped fence for low sloped wooden bridge section.
2m 26 degree sloped fence for same slope wooden bridge.
4m radius clockwise climbing spiral stairs.
4m radius counterclockwise climbing spiral stairs.
2m radius clockwise climbing spiral stairs.
2m radius counterclockwise climbing spiral stairs.
Fancy stone stairs.
Simple stone stairs. Pairs well with the platforms and a floor of your choice to make a fancy dais.
Simple inner corner stone stairs. Pairs well with the platforms and a floor of your choice to make a fancy dais.
Simple outer corner stone stairs. Pairs well with the platforms and a floor of your choice to make a fancy dais.
Simple 2m radius stone stairs. Pairs well with the platforms to make a fancy dais.
Simple 4m radius stone stairs. Pairs well with the platforms to make a fancy dais.
Wood door with iron strapping.
Wooden door with iron grate on the outside to protect the viewing slot. Unfortunately the viewing slot seems to have been nailed shut.
Hide your secrets with this hidden panel door, that looks to be a simple brick wall.
Lovely wood and iron double door surrounded by a stone frame.
Double door in an arched 4m radius wall.
Double doors set in a 2m radius curved wall.
Grand entrance double door. Snapps into the portcullis.
Castle Portcullis.
Simple wooden door.
Simple wooden drawbridge.
Simple wooden trap door.
Secret 2m arch door.
Secret 4m arch door.
Wooden door with some iron strapping.
Simple wooden window with shutters.
Stained glass pointed snap in window.
Large stained glass pointed snap in window.
Stained glass rounded snap in window.
Large stained glass rounded snap in window.
Wooden slat rounded snap in window.
Plain single wood framed window.
Small 4 pane wooden framed window.
Medium 6 pane wooden framed window.
Large 8 pane wooden framed window.
6m tall square wooden floor support.
6m tall rounded wooden floor support.
45 degree wooden, wall to floor brace.
Simple stone and wood pillar.
Fancy stone pillar.
More simple stone pillar.
Decorative stone half pillar. Place on the front of a wall.
Large fancy stone pillar
Pillar base
Middle snappable pillar piece.
Snappable pillar top piece
6m column for single quarter vaulted ceiling.
Quater vaulted ceiling
6m column for 4 of the quarter vaulted ceilings.
6m column with swords for 4 of the quarter vaulted ceilings.
Lovely stone fireplace.
Lovely stone fireplace.
Lovely stone fireplace.
Lovely stone fireplace for placing your own fire within. Can be used with the chimney.
Chimney for the fireplace for your own fires.
Rectangular staind glass with left facing griffen. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Rectangular staind glass with right facing griffen. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Pointed staind glass with left facing griffen. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Pointed staind glass with right facing griffen. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Tall pointed staind glass with left facing griffen. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Tall pointed staind glass with right facing griffen. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Square stained glass window. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Diamond shaped stained glass window. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Circular shaped stained glass window. Bright side intended to be towards the inside, must be placed on walls from the inside.
Decorative piece for the peak of tower rooofs.
Decorative cross piece for the peak of tower rooofs.
Decorative piece for the peak of tower rooofs.
Wooden fencing that's seen better days.
Wooden fencing that's seen better days.
Iron fencing on top of stone.
Simple iron fencing.
Fancy iron fencing.
Even fancier iron fencing.
Fancy gate to go with the fancy iron fence.
Stone and iron fence.
Fancy wooden fencing that can also be used as wood panneling.
Standard iron castle fencing.
Stone fence post to go with the simple iron fence, or the simple iron fence on stone.
Large stone fence post to go with the iron and stone fence.
Wooden fence post to go with the fancy wooden fence.
